Query making¶

QueryArXivCat class definition, used to retrieve arXiv following the arXiv API : https://arxiv.org/help/api/user-manual

class src.query_making.query_arxiv_cat.QueryArXivCat(result_folder, category, cyber_keywords=None)¶

Bases: object

This class retrieve all URLs of e-prints of categories contained in categories.

Parameters

  • result_folder – Path to the result folder where .csv data will be stored.

  • category (str) – arXiv category.

  • cyber_keywords (str) – Pre-formated queries of security considerations keywords.

ARXIV_LIMIT¶

arXiv API doesn’t allow to retrieve more than 50 000 e-prints

MAX_LOOP¶

Number max of loop, if a query doesn’t work

MAX_QUERY_RESULT¶

Number of wanted result per query

__PARAMS = {'max_results': 1, 'search_query': '', 'sortBy': 'submittedDate', 'sortOrder': 'ascending', 'start': 1}¶
__URL = 'http://export.arxiv.org/api/query'¶
__do_request_req(parameters, i=0)¶

Recursive function for retry request if a bug occur.

Parameters

  • parameters (dict) – restAPI parameters.

  • i (int) – recursive counter.

__get_max_results(search_query)¶

Do a request to obtain the size of a category.

Parameters

search_query (str) – formated query.

category¶

pandas.Series which contain categories

cyber_keywords¶

Formated query of security considerations keywords

static get_arxiv_path(paper_id, category, version)¶

Create the arXiv path.

Parameters

  • paper_id (str) – id of the e-print.

  • category (str) – category of the paper (if category == ‘abs’ then it uses only the paper_id).

  • version (str) – version of the e-print.

get_eprints(parameters, max_results, category, total_data)¶

Get all eprints of a category

Parameters

  • parameters (dict) – restAPI parameters.

  • max_results (int) – number of eprints to retrieve.

  • category (str) – name of the desired category to retrieve.

  • total_data ([pandas.DataFrame]) – list of eprints already retrieved.

processing()¶

Execute queries on arXiv

result_folder¶

Path to the result folder
